 Individualism is a good thing. I can see where the presentation the school is trying to make for itself could make the principle not want to allow the picture in the year book but there should have been rules in place for that before the incident happened. Presumably he was allowed to have the mohawk around school but not just in the year book, correct? If so it sounds like a stupid rule to me, but it is a private school and I guess they can make whatever rules they wish.

 Personally, I think individual expression is important to God and God might actually like the idea. However, since it is a private school, the student in question agreed to follow the rules, including the dictates of a prudish principal. In other words, if I was the prinicpal it would be fine with me for him to have a mohawk but since I am not, I would support the prinicpal on principle.

sundowner

Do they allow him to go to school with the mohawk? If so, they should let him represent himself in the yearbook. If he cannot be in the book, he should not be allowed to go to school till he gets his hair cut. And if the school has no written rules against it, then they have no right to come after him now, until they have a written rule that everyone is made aware of. Private school or not, we all have rights, and few of us can read minds.
